alert.note: Alert for Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 15 at 4:32PM EDT until July 15 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN HUNTERDON...NORTHWESTERN MERCER...SOUTHWESTERN SOMERSET AND SOUTHEASTERN BUCKS COUNTIES... At 431 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Hopewell to Newtown, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Trenton, Ewing, Princeton, Pennington, New Hope, Yardley, Newtown, Hopewell, Langhorne, Ivyland, Rocky Hill, Stockton, Washington Crossing, Skillman, Feasterville-Trevose, Belle Mead, Feasterville, Woodside, Richboro and Sergeantsville. This includes Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 70 and 76. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
